JGAL

Class GAL_MultiPointCrossover

  • java.lang.Object
    • JGAL.GAL_GeneticOperator
      • JGAL.GAL_Crossover
        • JGAL.GAL_MultiPointCrossover

  • public class GAL_MultiPointCrossover
extends GAL_Crossover
    The GAL_MultiPointCrossover extends from GAL_Crossover and is one of the Genetic Operators implemented by default.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GAL_MultiPointCrossover

        public GAL_MultiPointCrossover(double prob,
                       int nPoints)
                        throws NotValidOperationException
        Constructs a new GAL_MultiPointCrossover with a probability of ocurrence given by its first parameter and number of crossover points given by the second parameter.

        If the probability is out of the range [0,1], the prob will take the closest value in the range. As Example. The probability 1.5 is equal to probability 1 and the probability -1 is equal to probability 0.

        Parameters:
        prob - Probability of ocurrence for the Multi-Point Crossover.
        nPoints - Number of crossover points. If this value is 1, then it will act similar to a Classic Crossover Operator.
        Throws:
        NotValidOperationException - If the number of crossover points is not a pair or less than 1.

    • Method Detail

      • applyOperator

        public GAL_Population applyOperator(GAL_Population fathers,
                           GAL_ChromosomeConfig config)
                             throws NotValidOperationException
        Applies the multi-point crossover for a Population given as the first parameter under the restrictions given by the chromosome configuration.
        Specified by:
        applyOperator in class GAL_GeneticOperator
        Parameters:
        fathers - Population thats going to be modified by the operator.
        config - The configuration for the chromosomes of the current and next generation.
        Returns:
        A new population created after applying the Multi-Point crossover.
        Throws:
        NotValidOperationException - If an operation can't be done with the given parameters.
